item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 878) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a special rule for members of the uniformed services and Foreign Service in determining the exclusion of gain from the sale of a principal residence and to restore the tax exempt status of death gratuity payments to members of the uniformed services, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 139, H. Res. 126 is laid on the table.

item.title: Help Efficient, Accessible, Low-cost, Timely Healthcare (HEALTH) Act of 2003

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 49.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 225 - 201 (Roll no. 62). (text: CR H1817)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 225 - 201 (Roll no. 62).(text: CR H1817)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 201 (Roll no. 61).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 139.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1817-1829)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 11.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-34, by Mr. Reynolds.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-34, by Mr. Reynolds.

Provides for 80 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on the Judiciary and 40 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Energy and Commerce. The rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill. The rule provides that in lieu of the amendments recommended by the Committees on the Judiciary and on Energy and Commerce now printed in the bill, the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in the Rules Committee report (H. Rept. 108-34) shall be considered as adopted. The rule provides that H.Res. 126 is laid on the table.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5 (revising the liability system pertaining to health care delivery).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on March 12, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5 (revising the liability system pertaining to health care delivery).

Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5 (revising the liability system pertaining to health care delivery).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5) to improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
